children.value: module provides a lot of very useful functionality to access and interact with the file system.
There is no need to install it. Being part of the Node.js core, it can be used by simply requiring it:
Once you do so, you have access to all its methods, which include:
: check if the file exists and Node.js can access it with its permissions
: append data to a file. If the file does not exist, it's created
: change the permissions of a file specified by the filename passed. Related:
: change the owner and group of a file specified by the filename passed. Related:
: create a new hard link to a file
: read the contents of a directory
: read the content of a file. Related:
: read the value of a symbolic link
: returns the status of the file identified by the filename passed. Related:
: create a new symbolic link to a file
: truncate to the specified length the file identified by the filename passed. Related:
: remove a file or a symbolic link
: stop watching for changes on a file
: change the timestamp of the file identified by the filename passed. Related:
: start watching for changes on a file. Related:
: write data to a file. Related:
module is that all the methods are asynchronous by default, but they can also work synchronously by appending
